Gabriel Alexis Rondon Vielma

Bolsista de Doutorado do CNPq

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/2581456463573980
  • Última atualização do currículo em 29/07/2019

Possui Bacharelado (2011) e Mestrado (2015) em Matemáticas pela ''Universidad de Los Andes''. Tem experiência na área de Matemática, com ênfase em Sistemas Dinâmicos, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: teoria de bifurcação e sistemas dinâmicos descontínuos. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2017 - Atual
Smoothing of nonsmooth differential systems near regular-tangencial singularities and boundary limit cycle
Descrição: Understanding how tangential singularities evolves under smoothing processes was one of the first problem concerning regularization of Filippov systems. In this work, we are interested in regularizations of Filippov systems around visible regular-tangential singularities. More specifically, we aim to understand how the trajectories of the regularized system transits through the region of regularization. We apply our results to investigate regularizations of boundary limit cycles with degenerated contact with the switching manifold.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Gabriel Alexis Rondon Vielma - Integrante / Douglas Duarte Novaes - Coordenador.
2013 - 2015
Bifurcations of singular points in the Rossler system
Descrição: The objective of this project was to study bifurcations at the singular points of the Rossler system. Specifically, we found the singular points of this system, we will study its nature and determine the type of bifurcation of codimension one at these points. This objective is first approached by restricting said vector field to a transverse curve α(µ) to a certain surface and then using the saddle-node and Hopf n-dimensional bifurcation theorems.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Gabriel Alexis Rondon Vielma - Coordenador / Leonardo Mora - Integrante.
